Newton.Newton Free Library:
Newton Free Library, the public library of Newton, Massachusetts, provides an extensive collection of print, non-print, and electronic resources, a comprehensive reference service, and a wide array of educational and cultural programs for people of all ages.


== History ==
Before 1870, several citizen groups organized library societies to serve their neighborhoods, among them the Social Library Society of West Newton, the Adelphian Library and the Newton Centre Library Association.
In 1866, one of these groups, the Newton Library Association, purchased land to establish a public library for the residents of Newton.
